name: Il Salviatino

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Il Salviatino is a goregous old villa turned hotel nestled in the outskirts of Florence. If you're looking for a quiet, peaceful setting yet still close enough to the centre of the city, than this is perfect.
reviews.title: Exclusive and relaxing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff was very helpful and accommodating, the rooms are spacious and have beautiful views overlooking parts of Florence as well as the property's lush gardens. There was a wedding taking place during our stay and you could see why with the amazing backgrounds for pictures.
reviews.title: Absolutely fantastic, blissful stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Our breakfasts at the hotel were great, but we did have dinner at the hotel one night and weren't overly impressed with dinner. A bit overpriced and didn't really have an authentic Italian feel to it at all.
reviews.title: Fabulous hotel experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed at the hotel for 4 nights with family and really enjoyed our stay. Personally, my husband and I prefer to be downtown in the city when on vacation as we like to be able to walk everywhere - one 'drawback' for us for this hotel. We had a driver for our stay to get us around the city, but I believe the hotel also has a shuttle service to get you to and from the centre.
reviews.title: Amazing luxury (Villa) hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you're looking for a peaceful, serene setting with a hint of Tuscan countryside - then you will love Il Salviatino.
reviews.title: Wonderful service, beautiful hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel and its charming staff made us feel as if we were transported back in time to an age of gentile living. Luxury travel at its best. Beautiful, unpretentious, with with uncompromised attention to detail. Il Salviatino has replaced The Ritz, Paris as our favorite hotel. Truly a home away from home with the best staff anywhere. We will return! Bob & Larysa
reviews.title: A true six star experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were walk-in guests in the "Il Salviatino" just a few minutes before checking in we have seen the pictures at an online website,we were thrilled about them. The reception of the hotel was quiet small, it was a desk with one computer-they were really attending check in and! Check outs for all of the rooms. The reception staff was very friendly and they indeed were speaking a very good english! We took a double deluxe room but we were shown the suite "affresco" which was worth to see because of the beautiful fresco above the living /sleeping area. We stayed 2 nights and have enjoyed on both evenings the own restaurant which was overlooking the big garden, kitchen was good and again the staff very friendly. We wanted to enjoy the swimming pool area but it was not that nice as the rest of the hotel:it needs definetely a renovation. Nevertheless we had no regrets chosing this a bit pricey hotel...again... The pictures were made to seduce...
reviews.title: Worth to visit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: I attended a wedding at this fabulous location and it is utterly gorgeous for events while comfortable and quiet for accommodations. The grounds are breathtaking, the villa sits atop a hill that separates it from any humming coming from the road since it is conveniently located between Florence and Fiesole. Along with exquisite neighboring properties you feel like you're living in the renaissance!
reviews.title: Excellence and elegance all in one location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Situated on the border of Florence and Fiesole lies this 16th century palace with spectacular views over the city and the Duomo of Florence. Recently restored this small 44 room hotel has beautiful rooms and suites, delightful staff and splendid food, a charming spa and pool area and gorgeous gardens both formal and informal. The service is individual helpful and always with a smile.and provides a complimentary shuttle to the Duomo frequently and takes only 15 minutes. To sit on the terrace overlooking the terrace at any time of day is to die for. - a very romantic spot.
reviews.title: Bella Vista

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is our second stay at Il Salviatino. I thought the first stay was the ultimate in service and quality...but this one goes further...
reviews.title: A class apart!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is nothing about this property that leaves you asking for more. The staff, the food, the service, the rooms, the view - is the most amazing hotel experience I have ever had (and I travel 80% of the time). When you are looking for a holiday where someone is taking care of your need so you can relax (!), this is the property you want! Thank you, thank you, thank you Salviatino staff. You are absolutely amazing!
reviews.title: Amazing holiday!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had the great pleasure to visit the Salviatino during my holidays in Florence this summer. The hotel is a really gorgeous historical villa but the big thing about the Salviatino is that it is actually on top of a hill.. so you get a full view on all the surrounding green Toscan hills and Florence at the same time. I stayed there for an aperitivo for sunset.. and the spectacle was just magical! Technically speaking the hotel is 15mn away from Florence but the hotel provides free shuttle service between Florence and the hotel so not a problem at all!
reviews.title: A Somptuous Villa immersed by Toscan Hills.. 15mn away from Florence!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This trip was a surprise for my wife's birthday and she was blown away! So i was in the good books ;-) The surrounding area measures 4 hectares and it is all beautifully cared for, so before you even reach the hotel your thinking "wow this is nice" !
reviews.title: A Gem on the hillside !!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Manager Stefano is a really nice guy, as are all the hotel staff, all very friendly and nothing was too much trouble.
reviews.title: A Magical, Luxurious Getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was super cosy with a big soft bed and stunning views overlooking Florence, i really couldn't stop gazing out of the window! The TV and music system is concealed inside the mirror which is smart and its great to be able to watch a movie in bed, the sound is perhaps not as clear as it could be as the external speakers were not hooked up, but this wasn't a problem as we just turned it up louder. The rainforest shower was class...never been so drenched in a shower before!
reviews.title: Lovely Romantic Getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I have just returned from a marvelous three nights at the Salviatino.From the friendly welcome to the personaluized departure the entire sty was flawless.I was attending a meeting.The first night Welcome Cocktail party and the Buffet dinner were outstanding and the quality of food and service first class.The Suites and Rooms are well thought out and fit in with the atmosphere of the Palacio.The view from my suite 25 was extraordinary.However what really impressed me was the quality and genuine frindliness of the staff.I will return
reviews.title: Three Marvelous nights at the Il Salviatino

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I have just returned from a 4 night stay from the 26th October and were amazed by the reception we were met with when we arrived, Lino is the excellent "front of house" ambassador and immediately ushered us to the terrace and served us a glass of Prossecco while our bags were taken up to our room. The views from the terrace are stunning as is the hotel. Our room (21) was spacious and even had a spiral staircase leading up to a mezzanine gallery where there was additional seating. All the staff are attentive, friendly and charming- nothing is too much trouble. Breakfast every morning was a delight as the chef would send out "little treats" to the table for us to try - yummy. The restaurant staff were very attentive and always smiling. The whole hotel has a special ambience especially in the evening when they light all the candles around the gardens and staircase. There is a very reliable shuttle service to the town (approx 15 min trip) . Beautiful 5* villa, set amonst the Tuscan hills, we can definitely recommend this hotel to everyone. Roy & Karina Angelou
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel, wonderful staff & excellent service!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We stayed at Il Salviatino for two nights, booked by Andrew Harper. We were in Suite 25, which they said was one of their nicest suites. Lino greeted us as we arrived, and attended to every need! we actually appreciated their attentiveness, but they could back off just a bit and still provide excellent service.... We felt like we couldn't even walk in the back door without them asking us of we needed something! The meals were spectacular... I had some of the best veal I've ever had! The spa facilities were top drawer.... Incredible massage therapists!
reviews.title: Attentive...high class"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only downfalls to our stay was that our room was over the kitchen area, so we heard every timer, and smelled all of the wonderful food.... Even when we were trying to relax and stay in bed in the morning. and, the bed is a platform bed, which is too low to the ground for our preference, and very uncomfortable! Pillows were also not soft and plush. But, I'd stay there again!!!! So still give them high ranks, as it's pretty spectacular!
reviews.title: Che bellissima vista!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in this hotel for a surprise weekend away booked by my husband. The place literally took my breath away. We arrived late, but they whisked our bags away whilst they fixed us a welcome glass of prosecco at midnight. We walked out onto the terrace to enjoy our drink and the view of the duomo was simply beautiful. The grounds were spectacular. The staff was excellent - both friendly, charming and personable but also responsive (sit down by the pool with the paper after breakfast and after 30s someone arrives from nowhere with fresh tea and pool towels is but one example...). I'd recommend eating outside if you can to make the most of the view - we didnt eat in the restaurant but it seemed a lot more formal in comparison. It isn't in the centre of Florence - but this is in no way a drawback. It's a short cab ride (or free shuttle service) down to the centre and when you're inside you feel like you're miles away from everywhere. Beautiful.
reviews.title: Tuscan Paradise

description: Set on a hill of Fiesole, this award winning luxury hotel offers the most spectacular view of Florence. Guests will enjoy complimentary à la carte breakfast, wi-fi, parking, in room movies and shuttle service to Florence.There are three different choices of accommodation: the Villa Rooms, the Green House Suites and our Signature Suites. Each offer a very different stay but all have inspiring view. All rooms fuse grand Renaissance style with contemporary luxe living, seamlessly blending the old and new. Everything from our linens and towels to the buttery leathers dressing the rooms have been carefully created by bespoke and exclusive artisans to offer you an indulgent experience at every turn. All rooms include Nespresso coffee machines, complimentary water and soft drinks and wide selection of complimentary in room movie and music.Food and beverage at Il Salviatino has been conceived to be far more than a service, but rather an unforgettable journey to the roots of Tuscan gastronomy.The day starts with our award-winning breakfasts which can be enjoyed at any time (and in any place) you so desire. Throughout the day you will be able to enjoy a series of local specialties all carefully crafted by our Chef, Carmine Caló. The main trait of our cuisine is an absolute obsession for using only the finest local ingredients. Simple, incredibly flavourful and elegantly presented.Immersed amongst the rolling hills adjacent to the Villa, one enters a truly magical world at our Spa and Pool area. The Spa at Salviatino by Vranjes, unites Il Salviatino’s idyllic setting and renowned service with the ancestral knowledge and delicate aroma’s of Dr Vranjes, one of Florence’s most exclusive perfume houses.Together we have created and scented path in which you will be able to enjoy a vast array of treatments and massages… each unique and magical.From April to October you will also be able to enjoy our pools. Immersed in the green hills, with stunning and relaxing views, you will find it hard to believe you are lying just 15 minutes away from the hustle & bustle of down town Florence.
